medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe anaphylaxis due to camel milk protein
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The 6-year-old boy had sudden onset of cough, wheezing, itching, and facial swelling very soon after consuming fresh camel milk. He was unresponsive and in severe respiratory distress with cyanosis upon arrival at the emergency department.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history included asthma, eczema, and food allergies. He was allergic to peanut, multiple tree nuts, coconut, and sesame, which caused facial angioedema. He had four emergency visits and three hospital admissions for asthma exacerbations. He was on fluticasone proprionate/salmeterol inhaler until 1 month prior to this anaphylactic event. He never had anaphylaxis in the past.
medical_history.family_history: He had five siblings, two with asthma. His father had asthma, and his mother had allergic rhinitis, contact dermatitis, and allergies to local anesthetics.
